plurals.name: isolation_view_accessibility_description
plurals.item: You need to self isolate until %1$s at 23:59. There is %2$s day to go until then.
You need to self isolate until %1$s at 23:59. There are %2$s days to go until then.

plurals.name: contact_case_start_isolation_how_we_calculate_isolation_days_isolation_period
plurals.item: You should self-isolate for %d full day after the date of close contact.
You should self-isolate for %d full days after the date of close contact.

plurals.name: contact_case_start_isolation_how_we_calculate_isolation_days_days_since_encounter
plurals.item: You came into close contact with someone %d day ago who has since reported a positive COVID-19 test result in the app.
You came into close contact with someone %d days ago who has since reported a positive COVID-19 test result in the app.

plurals.name: contact_case_start_isolation_how_we_calculate_isolation_days_remaining_days
plurals.item: Your remaining self-isolation period is %d day.
Your remaining self-isolation period is %d days.

resources.string:
The app will send you an alert if you have been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for the virus.

To enable contact tracing for this app you need to allow ‘Exposure Notifications’.

To get alerts you need to allow notifications.

If you change your mind, you can change your permissions in settings at any time.
Contact tracing helps prevent the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19)
If you are outside of England and Wales, you need to follow the guidance for the country you are in.
Enter the first part of your postcode (postcode district)

The postcode district helps with learning about the spread of coronavirus in different areas. This makes sure we can give the best possible public health advice for your area.\n\nDon’t worry. Your postcode district won’t be used to track your location.
Please enter your postcode district code. This is the first part of a postcode. For example: E2, L36, PO30.
For this app to work, you must have Bluetooth on

This app uses Bluetooth to know when it is near another phone with this app installed. If you have Bluetooth turned off, this app will not work.

This app uses ‘Bluetooth Low Energy’ - a battery saving technology.

Please go to settings and turn on Bluetooth.
Please activate Bluetooth in your device settings.
You need to enable location services on your phone

To make Bluetooth work, we need you to turn on location services on your phone.

This app is not using Bluetooth or your location to track you. Your personal identity will remain protected at all times.

If you do not enable location services on your phone this app will not work.

To enable this app to work, please go to settings and enable location services.

You need an English or Welsh postcode district to use this app.\n\nExamples: If your postcode is CE1B 2PQ, please enter ‘CE1B‘. If it is CR0 3RL, please enter ‘CR0’. If it is L4 0RE, please enter ‘L4’.
Why do we need your postcode district?

Choosing ‘Book a test for yourself’ will take you to the government’s coronavirus testing website where you will be asked to fill in some personal details (like your address) to get a test. Nothing you enter on the website will be shared.\n\nA digital ‘token‘ will be created to help us get your results back to the app.
Choosing ‘Book a free test nowʼ will redirect you from this app to the governmentʼs coronavirus testing website.
Once there, you will be asked to fill in some personal details (like your address) so you can get a test, but nothing you enter on the app or website will be shared.
The only information shared between app and website is a digital ‘tokenʼ which helps us get your test results back to the app.
Any data used in the testing process is described in the privacy notice:
To find out about how this app uses your data, please visit:
Book a test for someone else
Allow ‘Exposure notifications’ for this app to work

This is how the app tells you if you’ve been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.

Your phone may call these ‘Exposure notifications’ or ‘Exposure logging’.

Go to your phone settings and change to ‘Allow’.
Scan an official NHS QR code poster to check in
How it helps us stay safe
Thank you for checking in to %1$s
The app is the fastest way to be alerted of potential exposure to coronavirus at a venue.
You may have scanned a code that is not an official NHS QR code, the code may be damaged, or this venue may not be recognised.
We advise you to speak to a member of staff at the venue to see if there are other ways of checking in.
Before trying again, please check that your phone’s mobile data settings are on, check your Wi-Fi connection (if you’re using one) and make sure that Airplane Mode is off.
Venue notification. You may have been exposed to COVID-19 at a venue you recently checked into. Tap here for advice.
The app provides advice to help keep you and others safe. Tap here for more information.
These notifications help to keeping track of the risk of infection in your area.
These notifications inform about your isolation status
These notifications inform about your test results
These notifications inform about your app availability
These notifications tell you about recommended app updates
These notifications inform about your app configuration
These notifications inform about your app’s background activities
These notifications remind you to share random IDs
These notifications provide you with information relevant to your local area
These notifications inform about available resources when self isolating
Let others know they may be at risk of coronavirus, while protecting your privacy.
Our guidance to you has changed
Close contact notification. You have been in close contact with someone who has COVID-19. Tap here for advice.
The app provides advice to help keep you and others safe. Tap here for more information.
The app is not currently available
Please update your NHS COVID-19 app to the latest version
Turn contact tracing back on to help protect you and others
Tap here for advice and support.
Scan an official NHS QR code poster to check in
This app uses your camera to check in to venues like bars and restaurants.\n\nPlease allow camera permissions to scan the official NHS QR code.
Enter your test result using the code sent by email or text message
You cannot enter a test result code and confirm that you have a negative test result at the same time.
No internet. Please connect to your network or WiFi and try again.
Something went wrong. Please try again.
Did you have any of the following coronavirus symptoms?

A high temperature

A new continuous cough

A change to your sense of smell or taste
No, I did not have symptoms.
Do you remember the earliest date that you began to experience any of these symptoms?
Do you have any of these symptoms of COVID-19?
Select all that apply, even if they are mild.
Before trying again, please check that your phone’s mobile data settings are on, check your Wi-Fi connection (if you’re using one) and make sure that Airplane Mode is off.
Confirm you do not have any of these symptoms
Any selected symptoms will be unselected.
You may have been exposed to COVID-19 at a venue you recently checked into. Tap here for advice.
You recently visited a venue on the same day as others who have since tested positive for coronavirus (COVID-19)

There is a risk that you may have been exposed to the virus. For this reason, we recommend booking a test now.

If you do not have any COVID-19 symptoms, select “Testing for COVID-19” from the home screen of this app to find out how to get a rapid lateral flow test.

If you have COVID-19 symptoms, select “Check symptoms” from the home screen of this app and book a polymerase chain reaction (PCR) test.

Please continue to follow all the latest guidance, even if you have been vaccinated.

For further information, advice, or support please call 119.
You recently visited a venue where you may have been exposed to COVID-19
To continue you need to either select your symptoms or select ”I have different symptoms”
You do not have any of the main symptoms
You can still get a coronavirus test, even if you do not have one of the listed symptoms.\n\nFind out more about the coronavirus testing options available to you:
You need to either enter a date or select “I donʼt remember the date”
I do not remember the date
Do you remember the first time you started feeling any of these symptoms?
You do not appear to have coronavirus symptoms
Your coronavirus test result is positive
Your coronavirus test result is negative but you may still develop symptoms, so you should stay in isolation
We could not tell if you had coronavirus
Your coronavirus test result is positive.

Your test result shows that you did not have the virus when the test was done. You have been sent more information by email or text.\n\nIf you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
You have been released from isolation since the %s at 23:59
If you feel unwell, stay at home until you feel better
Visit our common questions page to learn more about the NHS COVID-19 app and the wider programme.
Our policies tells you important information about using the app, how we use your data, and how the app is designed to be usable by everyone.

UK Health Security Agency
Nobel House
17 Smith Square
London
SW1P 3HX
UK
Although you tested positive, your period for self-isolation is over
If you feel unwell, stay at home until you feel better

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the link to the FAQs below.\n\nYour test result shows that you had the virus at the time of the test. You have been sent an email or text with more information.
Don’t worry - for most people symptoms are quite mild. However, if your symptoms do worsen then you should call 111 or visit nhs.uk for more advice.
If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.

Because you took a rapid swab test, you now need to get another type of test that is sent to a lab to verify the result.

In the meantime, you and anyone you live with must self-isolate immediately.
Your coronavirus test result is negative

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.


We could not tell if you had coronavirus when the test was done and you should take the test again. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
Your coronavirus test result is negative

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.


We could not tell if you had coronavirus when the test was done and you should take the test again. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
This means you could be at the start of infection with coronavirus (COVID-19) or recovering from infection
Refer to your test result email or text message for guidance on what to do.
Anonymously notify others that they were near someone who tested positive for coronavirus.
No one will know the notification came from you and your personal data will not be shared.
Proceed to share this result below.\n\nWhen prompted, select ‘Share’ or ‘Share your device’s random IDs’.

This app uses contact tracing technology to help protect yourself and others so we can all get back to the things we love.

The app notices and logs other nearby app users. If any of those users later test positive for coronavirus, you’ll receive an alert with advice.

The app also lets you report your symptoms and find out if you need a test.

You can also use it to scan official NHS QR codes to quickly and easily check in to places you visit.

The app has access to the postcode district you added in the registration, a history of the places you’ve checked into in the last 14 days, your last test result and the start date of your symptoms. When you use QR codes to check into venues, venue data is stored for 21 days. You can delete the stored data whenever you want.
You can manage your data in the app settings.
Deleting your data will reset the app
Checking in helps notify people who might have been exposed to coronavirus (COVID-19) at a venue they visited.\n\nNobody will know the notification is linked to you.

“Check in to a venue” - like a restaurant or bar - quickly and easily by using this app to scan NHS QR code posters. This can let you know if you may have been exposed to the virus somewhere you have visited.
How to scan an NHS QR code poster
Hold your phone so that the QR code appears in the box on the previous page. When your phone recognises the QR code, it will show that you have successfully checked in.
Help if you cannot scan the code
We advise you to speak to a member of staff at the venue to see if there are other ways of checking in.
How to recognise an NHS QR code poster
Here are what the official NHS QR code posters look like. You need to scan the code, which is the square in the middle.
English hospitality NHS QR code poster:
Here is an example of an English NHS QR code poster
Here is an example of a Welsh NHS QR code poster
Here is an example of an English Hospitality NHS QR code poster
This app helps us keep each other safe
You will be helping us beat COVID-19 by sharing anonymous information about the virus in your region and public health when you use the app.
Find out when you’ve been near other app users who have tested positive for coronavirus.
Use the app’s QR code scanner to check into places like bars and restaurants without having to fill out any forms.
Feeling unwell? Find out whether you could have coronavirus and order a free test if you need one.
If you are isolating, the app will count down the days and give you the right information.
You must confirm that you are 16 years or over to be able to use this app.
Unfortunately, this app is only for people aged 16 years or over
Thank you for your interest. This app is only for people aged 16 years or over.

The NHS values your privacy, meaning the app cannot tell who you are, where you are or who is with you.

If you test positive for coronavirus, you can choose to share your data with the NHS so we can alert other app users in England, Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland, Jersey and Gibraltar. By selecting continue we will be able to send notifications to other app users who need to be alerted across these locations.

We use automated decision making to help determine which other users need to be anonymously alerted.

The app securely and anonymously stores data for 14 days after it has been recorded. When you use QR codes to check into venues, venue data is stored for 21 days. You can delete the data from the app at anytime in your app settings, or by uninstalling the app. Your phone may keep some basic data – this is controlled by your phone’s operating system.
When you use the app you will be helping your community stay healthy and save lives. Anonymous information from the app helps us know where the virus is and how to control it.
Before you activate this app, please read the privacy notice and agree to the terms of use.
Important: Before you activate this app, please read the privacy notice and agree to the terms of use.
No thanks, I do not agree
If Bluetooth is turned off, contact tracing will not work. This is how the app calculates if someone may have been exposed to COVID-19 and will notify others who were in close contact.
It will not drain your battery
Contact tracing uses a battery-saving Bluetooth technology. This estimates how long you‘ve been in close contact with other app users.
This app is not used to identify your location.
Your personal details cannot be accessed by this app and will remain protected at all times.
App is active and helping to protect you and others

Any information you share through this app will only be used for public health purposes. Data held will be removed once you click “Delete data”. This deletion includes any active self-isolation periods and how much time you have remaining. Please note that your phone will retain some information, such as the data your phone collects to log other app users. This data is not controlled by the app but by your phone’s operating system. After deletion if you want to use this app again you will have to set it up again.
Go to the Google Play Store
Unfortunately, this app is not working
restricted settings on your phone (for example, if this is a company phone)\n\nunsupported hardware (for example, if your phone does not support Android 6.0 or higher)
Find out what you can do to continue using the app.
Code not recognised or may have expired. Make sure you are not trying to enter a rapid lateral flow self-test ID number.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the link to the FAQs below.

Your symptoms suggest you may have coronavirus. Please isolate yourself and anyone else in your household. That means staying at home with no visitors. You should also book a free test immediately. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

Please stay at home to keep yourself and others safe.
You do not appear to have any COVID-19 symptoms, but it can take time for symptoms to develop.\n\nYou are advised to stay at home to keep yourself and others safe.
Your self-isolation will finish on %1$s at 23:59
Sorry, your phone doesn’t support venue check-in
We advise you to speak to a member of staff at the venue to see if there are other ways of checking in.
Scanning for an official NHS QR code
The app has detected that you have been in contact with someone who has coronavirus (COVID-19).

If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

You are at high risk of having and spreading COVID-19, even if you don’t have any symptoms. You are advised to stay at home to keep yourself and others safe. By self-isolating for the full period identified, you are helping to stop the spread of COVID-19.

Because you’re a contact of someone who tested positive, you can book a test to see if you have COVID-19. If you test positive, you can anonymously let others know they may be at risk. If you test negative, you could still be infectious. Follow the advice given to you when you receive your test result.

You can book a test from the home screen of your app.
Check what testing is available in your area and whether you need to book.
Thank you for protecting yourself and others by using the app
Are you sure you want to delete this venue from your history?
Removing a venue will reduce the effectiveness of contact tracing.\n\nOnce deleted, you will no longer receive alerts about this venue.
The app will remind you to turn on contact tracing in %1$s hours
Turn contact tracing back on to help protect you and others.
Choose when the app will remind you to turn on contact tracing.
Don’t worry. Your postcode district will not be used to track your location.
Unfortunately this app is not supported in your region. Please download the app for your region or country.
Visit the link to find out more
If you have feedback about the app, a question that’s not answered in our common questions, or you have a technical problem, you can contact us using our online form.
Your coronavirus test result is negative. However, you should stay in self-isolation. This is because you either have a previous positive test result or have recently reported symptoms.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the FAQs.\n\nYour current test result shows that you did not have the virus at the time of testing. If you have recently reported symptoms, make sure you have booked a test. If you develop symptoms, report them on this app. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the link to the FAQs below.\n\nYour test result shows that you had the virus at the time of the test. You have been sent more information by email, text or phone. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
This is an example of an official NHS QR code poster for hospitality venues in England
Currently only for NHS Volunteer Responders, Isle of Wight and Newham residents
Where can I find this code?
We could not tell if you had coronavirus

The test result shows that at the time of testing, you did not have the virus. If you do develop symptoms, report them on this app. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
If you feel unwell, stay at home until you feel better
Any data used in the application process is described in the privacy notice:

The app has detected that you have been in contact with a person who has tested positive for coronavirus. You are advised to self-isolate.

While you’re self-isolating, you may be able to claim financial support depending on your circumstances. Check if you are eligible as soon as possible by using the button below.

This will take you to a website where you may need to enter some personal details. These personal details will not be stored anywhere in this app.
If you live in England and you are having trouble applying, visit:
Help to apply for the Test and Trace Support Payment
If you live in Wales and are having trouble applying, visit:
Help to apply for the Self-Isolation Support Scheme

If you are entering a venue (for example, a bar or a restaurant) that has an official NHS QR code poster, use this app to scan it. The app then registers the time you check in to a venue.\n\nBy using the venue check-in, you will be able to get a notification if people with coronavirus visit the same venue at a similar time as you. The notification will include relevant advice, such as to look out for coronavirus symptoms.

Thank you for using the NHS COVID-19 app. 

We have made changes to the app to align with new policy. 

Those who are fully vaccinated or under 18 are no longer advised to self-isolate if they have been in contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19, but they are advised to get tested.

If you are already self-isolating as a contact and are fully vaccinated or under 18, you do not need to continue to self-isolate. 

If you have symptoms or have tested positive, you should complete your self-isolation period.

Keep the app on your device to stay up to date with the latest advice and help stop the spread of COVID-19.

The Terms of Use and Privacy Notice are updated to reflect these changes.

To understand how the app calculates self-isolation days, visit the link to the FAQs below.\n\nYour test result shows that you had the virus at the time of the test. You have been sent more information by email, text or phone. If you are under 18, you are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.

Great news! The app is going to be more accurate at giving information and guidance for the level of coronavirus risk in your area.\n\nDon‘t worry, your privacy is still protected. The app will never track your identity or location.

As your postcode district (%s) is in more than one local authority, you need to select the one you are in. This is so the app can give you more accurate information and guidance.\n\nVisit GOV.UK if you do not know your local authority.
You need to choose a local authority to continue
Unfortunately this app is not supported in your region. Please download the app for your region or country.
Please select a local authority. This is so the app can give you more accurate information and guidance.
Don’t worry, we have assessed your risk and there is no need to take action at this time. Please continue to stay alert and follow the latest advice on social distancing.
A restriction in your settings (for example, if this is a company phone).\n\nAnother app on your phone is using the same technology and stopping this app from working.
Delete all my data and reset the app
This app feature makes it easy for businesses to support contact tracing. It helps all of us stay safe, while keeping your privacy protected.
You will be asked to share “random IDs.” This is a randomly generated code which can be shared with other phones that have Exposure Notifications switched on.
It lets other app users know they were near someone who tested positive for coronavirus.
Nobody will know the notification is linked to you.
Thank you for helping to stop the spread of COVID-19.
If you develop any of the listed symptoms, report them on this app.\n\nFor further advice, please visit:
Notify others who may be at risk of coronavirus (COVID-19)
Nobody will know the notification is linked to you.

You may have been in contact with more people than you realise. The app can alert people who you have been near, but do not know personally, to let them know they may be at risk. By sharing your result, you are helping keep your community safe.
Camera is active. Point it at an official NHS QR code poster to check in to a venue.
Contact tracing helps protect you and others from coronavirus (COVID-19).\n\nYou should only pause contact tracing when you:

store your phone in a locker or communal area

are working behind a fixed transparent screen and are fully protected from other people

are a worker in health and social care wearing medical grade PPE such as a surgical mask

are a healthcare worker working in a healthcare building such as a hospital or GP surgery
You can set a reminder in the app to tell you to turn contact tracing back on.
should not make much difference to battery life\n\ncannot track your location
Book a free lab test now
You can book a test if you have symptoms or you’ve been told to get a lab test
Find out about the different types of COVID-19 test and how to get tested
Find out how to get rapid lateral flow tests for COVID-19 (if you do not have symptoms), how to take a test and what your test result means
Enter your 8 character code if you have received one by email or text message
If you need to get a follow-up test you can book one from the home screen of your app.\n\nPlease note that the self-isolation timer on your app will not update from this test result.

be 8 characters long

use lowercase letters and numbers

be in an email or text message sent to you separately from your result
If you’re trying to enter a code from a rapid lateral flow self-test kit, you first need to:
Update the app to see your test result

Your test result is valid, but not supported by this version of the app.

Once you update the app, your result code might not work because it has expired or been entered too many times.

Please follow the guidance you’ve received by email or text message on what actions to take next.
Your coronavirus (COVID-19) test result is positive. Please book a follow-up test and self-isolate.

Because you tested positive from a rapid lateral flow test, we advise you get another type of test to confirm the result. Please book this follow-up test as soon as possible.\n\nIn the meantime, you and anyone you live with are advised to self-isolate. You are advised to only leave home to get your follow-up test.
Your test result is weak positive
Stop or start the moving circles on your home screen.
This will not change how your app works. It will only change the animation.
Change your device settings to allow home screen circle animation.
Your device accessibility settings are stopping animations. You will need to change this to turn on animations in the NHS COVID-19 app.
This app does not contain your coronavirus (COVID-19) vaccination status

This app protects your privacy and identity. It does not know who you are and is not linked to your medical records.\n\nIf you live in England, use the separate NHS app to see your COVID-19 status and other health information.
You have reported symptoms after testing positive
This means your isolation period has changed to 10 full days from the day your symptoms started. This is to avoid spreading the virus on to others.
Your symptoms started before your positive test result. Your self-isolation period has not changed.
Keep track of your self-isolation period with the countdown timer on the app home screen.
You do not have any of the main coronavirus (COVID-19) symptoms, but your test result was positive

It is important to continue to self-isolate as you tested positive.\n\nPlease stay at home to keep yourself and others safe. Keep track of your self-isolation period with the countdown timer on the app home screen.
Welsh Higher Risk Venue NHS QR code poster:
Here is an example of a Welsh Higher Risk Venue NHS QR code poster
The type of test depends on whether you have symptoms
The main symptoms of coronavirus (COVID-19) are:

A high temperature

A new continuous cough

A change to your sense of smell or taste
If you think you may have COVID-19 symptoms, even if they are mild, select ‘Check symptoms‘ below. Call 119 for more information or advice.
I do not have any of these symptoms
Get a rapid lateral flow test kit or use an existing one at home

Get a free rapid lateral flow test kit if you do not have any of the main COVID-19 (coronavirus) symptoms.\n\nYour workplace, school, college, university or council may also be able to provide you with a free test kit.
I already have a test kit
When should I pause contact tracing?
When should I pause contact tracing?
The app does not track your location. The app uses Bluetooth to estimate how long you had close contact with someone.
The app cannot access your personal details.
You should not notice an impact on your battery life.
You should only pause contact tracing if you:
When should I pause contact tracing?

store your phone in a locker or communal area

are working behind a fixed transparent screen and are fully protected from other people

are a worker in health and social care wearing medical grade personal protective equipment (PPE) such as a surgical mask

are a healthcare worker in a healthcare building such as a hospital or GP surgery
Remember to turn contact tracing back on once you leave this situation.
You do not need to self-isolate, but we advise that you take a test.
Around 1 in 3 people who have COVID-19 do not have symptoms, but they can still pass it on and put others at risk.
You should do this even if you have been fully vaccinated.
Are you sure you want to leave?
If you tap ‘Leave’ you can restart this process later and book a test by selecting ‘Testing for COVID-19’ from the home screen.
Book a free test while you’re self-isolating
You may be at risk of spreading coronavirus (COVID-19)
Check if you’re eligible for financial support
Learn about applying for a financial support payment while self-isolating
Get an isolation note to show your employer
The app does not hold or share your personal information with this service, so you will need to enter your details
Stay at home to reduce the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19).\n\nWhat you should do when told to self-isolate:

do not leave your home for any reason – if you need food or medicine, order it online or by phone, or ask friends and family to drop it off at your home. Learn more about practical support available to you in the next section

do not have visitors in your home, including friends and family – except for essential care

try to avoid contact with anyone you live with as much as possible

exercise at home or in your garden, do not leave your home to exercise
If you live in a household with other people:

stay as far away as possible from other household members, especially if they are clinically extremely vulnerable

avoid using shared spaces wherever possible

take your meals back to your room

wear a face covering or surgical mask when spending time in shared areas in your home
If you cannot rely on support from family, friends and neighbours while you’re self-isolating, your local authority may be able to help with things like:

accessing food

practical tasks such as dog walking

assistance with caring responsibilities

signposting to mental health and well-being support

You can find more information, including the helpline number, on your local authority’s website.

In England, there is a free medicines delivery service available if you need prescription medication collecting during your period of self-isolation. Speak to your local pharmacy for more information.

NHS Volunteer Responders can also offer advice and support during your self-isolation period. Call 0808 196 3646 to arrange help from a volunteer.

In Wales, you can find further information on advice and support by searching online for ’help for the vulnerable from local authorities and voluntary groups’.

There is a risk that you may have been exposed to the virus. Around 1 in 3 people who have COVID-19 do not have any symptoms, but they can still pass it on and put others at risk.

For this reason, we recommend booking a test now.

You do not need to self-isolate, but you should continue to follow the latest advice on washing your hands regularly and maintaining social distancing. You and your household should self-isolate immediately if you develop any symptoms.

If you test positive you, and others in your household, must self-isolate immediately.

You do not need to book a test if you have tested positive in the past 90 days, unless you have symptoms.

Please continue to follow all the latest guidance, even if you have been vaccinated.

For further information, advice, or support please call 119.

store your phone in a locker or communal area

are working behind a fixed transparent screen and are fully protected from other people

are a worker in health and social care wearing medical grade personal protective equipment (PPE) such as a surgical mask

are a healthcare worker in a healthcare building such as a hospital or GP surgery
You should only pause contact tracing if you:
Remember to turn contact tracing back on once you leave this situation.
You should only pause contact tracing if you:
Self-isolate and take a free COVID-19 test
You are advised to take a free rapid lateral flow test as soon as possible. You should also take a second rapid lateral flow test on the %s.
Book a free PCR test if you have symptoms.
Book a free PCR test if you have symptoms.
Book a free PCR test if you have symptoms.
Book a free PCR test to see if you have COVID-19.
You are at high risk of catching and spreading COVID-19, even if you don’t have any symptoms. By staying at home you can help keep yourself and others safe.
If you have not already done so, you should take a free COVID-19 test as soon as possible
If you have not already done so, you can book a free PCR test from ‘Testing for COVID-19’ on the home screen.
You are at high risk of spreading COVID-19. By staying at home you can help keep yourself and others safe.
You do not need to self-isolate unless you test positive or have symptoms
You do not need to self-isolate unless you test positive or have symptoms
To reduce risk, you should take and report a daily rapid lateral flow test for 7 days
To reduce risk, you should take and report a daily rapid lateral flow test for 7 days
Book a free PCR test if you have symptoms.
Help to stop the spread of COVID-19 by wearing a face covering over your nose and mouth on public transport, in shops and crowded places, and washing your hands regularly.
It is still important to follow national guidance, including reducing contact with others, especially the elderly and vulnerable.
It is still important to follow national guidance, including reducing contact with others, especially the elderly and vulnerable.
You do not need to self-isolate unless you test positive or have symptoms
You do not need to self-isolate unless you test positive or have symptoms
To reduce risk, you should take and report a daily rapid lateral flow test for 7 days
To reduce risk, you should take and report a daily rapid lateral flow test for 7 days
Book a free PCR test if you have symptoms.
It is still important to follow national guidance, including reducing contact with others, especially the elderly and vulnerable.
You are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
You are advised to show this message to a trusted adult.
You do not need to self-isolate unless you test positive or have symptoms
To reduce risk, you should take and report a daily rapid lateral flow test for 7 days
Book a free PCR test if you have symptoms.
As more people are vaccinated, the risk to those wo are medically exempt is lower.
It is still important to follow national guidance, including reducing contact with others, especially the elderly and vulnerable.
For fairness and equality, if you are unable to get the vaccine for medical reasons you do not need to self-isolate.
The app has detected that you have been near someone who tested positive for coronavirus (COVID-19)
You may need to self-isolate depending on your age, vaccination status, or instructions from contact tracers
If you have symptoms, select “Check symptoms” on the home screen and get a test.
We will only use your answers to check if you may need to self–isolate.
Were you aged 18 or over on 16 February 2021?
Were you aged 18 or over on %s?
Yes, I was aged 18 or over on %s
No, I was not aged 18 or over on %s
To continue, you need to select an answer
We will only use your answers to check if you may need to self–isolate.
To continue, you need to select an answer
Are you fully vaccinated against COVID-19?
This means you have had all doses of a UK-approved vaccine.
Yes I am fully vaccinated against COVID-19
No I am not fully vaccinated against COVID-19
Were you fully vaccinated on or before %s?
Yes, I received my last dose on or before %s
No I did not receive my last dose on or before %s

The app uses Bluetooth to check if your phone has been in close contact with others.

Close contact means you were within 2 metres of someone for 15 minutes or more.

The app is anonymous and does not use GPS or venue check-in to track your location, so your privacy is protected.
Are you taking part in an MHRA-approved COVID-19 vaccine clinical trial?
Yes I am taking part in an MHRA-approved COVID-19 vaccine clinical trial
No I am not taking part in an MHRA-approved COVID-19 vaccine clinical trial
Are you medically exempt from receiving a COVID-19 vaccine?
Yes I am medically exempt from receiving a COVID-19 vaccine
No I am not medically exempt from receiving a COVID-19 vaccine
This means you have proof that you are not able to get vaccinated for medical reasons
You are advised to book a free PCR test as soon as possible. After your first test, you should also book a second PCR test as soon as possible.
You are advised to book a free PCR test as soon as possible. After your first test, you should also book a second PCR test as soon as possible.

You are advised to book a free PCR test as soon as possible. After your first test, you should also book a second PCR test as soon as possible
You need Bluetooth to use contact tracing

Contact tracing helps to prevent the spread of COVID-19 by letting you know if you’ve been in close contact with someone who has tested positive.\n\nFor contact tracing to work, and to help keep you and your loved ones safe:
You can change these permissions in your phone settings.

turn on Bluetooth in your phone settings

allow ‘Exposure notifications’

allow ‘Notifications’
Contact tracing does not work without Bluetooth
Turn on Bluetooth in your phone settings

Contact tracing helps to prevent the spread of COVID-19 by letting you know if you’ve been in close contact with someone who has tested positive.\n\nTurn on Bluetooth to help to stop the spread of COVID-19. You can continue to use this app without Bluetooth, but contact tracing will not work.
Contact tracing does not work without Bluetooth
Turn on Bluetooth in your phone settings
